#definining the variables
#qi = quantity purchased in month i <= 200
#ri = quantity purchased in month i > 200
#si = representing the stock at the end of month i
#bi = 1 if > 200 units are purchased on month i
#di = monthly demand
#where i = month 1,2,3,4
#total purchase in a given month = qi + ri
#constraints

```{r}
library(lpSolveAPI)
x <- read.lp("assignment3.lp")
x
solve(x)
get.objective(x)
get.variables(x)
get.constraints(x)
get.sensitivity.rhs(x)
```

Add a new chunk by clicking the *Insert Chunk* button on the toolbar or by pressing *Ctrl+Alt+I*.

When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the *Preview* button or press *Ctrl+Shift+K* to preview the HTML file).
